text:
Printing from your phone
is pretty straightforward

since most printers these
days have WiFi capability.

We are going to demonstrate
printing from Google Docs.

The process will be
similar in different apps.
If an app supports printing,

you can almost always
find the print command

in the app's menu, such
as the three-dot menu.
Make sure that your printer is turned on
and that the wireless feature is enabled.
Make sure your Android phone is connected
to the same WiFi network as the printer.
Start the app you want to print from
and then open the document.
In this case, open Google Docs.
Tap the three-dot menu at the top right.
Tap "Share & export."
Then choose "Print."

At the top of the page,
select the printer.

Options will include
printing to a PDF file --
this converts your document into a PDF --

and any wireless printers
that are on your network.
Select any additional options,

such as the number of
copies or your page size.

Then tap the printer
icon to start printing.
